Description: Fragment of handle of pottery transport amphora with two inscribed letters (pi and omikron; post-firing graffiti); light brown-pink clay with numerous lime and stone inclusions; buff surface. Post-firing hole at top end of fragment.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The findspot 'Scarab Factory' noted in the Boston MFA database may be incorrect, deriving from an erroneous association of the piece with another registration number
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JA.110)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
